definitions.definition: A political state, often a monarchy, that has achieved a much greater current size than its initial size by conquering surrounding territories, cities or nations.
A political unit ruled by an emperor or empress .
examples: The Empire of Vietnam was a short-lived client state of Japan governing Vietnam between March 11 and August 23, 1945.

definitions.definition: The group of states or other territories that owe allegiance to an imperial power (foreign to them), when distinguished from the native territory of that power; imperial possessions.
An expansive and powerful enterprise under the control of one person or group.
